intro: Melandrium sylvestre subsp. villosum, commonly known as the hairy catchfly, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its hairy texture and delicate appearance make it a distinctive member of its genus.
